de.upb.t2t.control.sqlite

Class SQLiteBridgeDesktop

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.upb.t2t.control.database.AbstractSQLiteBridge
      • de.upb.t2t.control.sqlite.SQLiteBridgeDesktop

  • public class SQLiteBridgeDesktop
extends AbstractSQLiteBridge
    An implementation of the AbstractSQLiteBridge class on a desktop operating system.
    Author:
    Michel May (michel-may@gmx.de

    • Method Detail

      • openDatabase

        public void openDatabase()
                  throws java.lang.ClassNotFoundException,
                         java.sql.SQLException,
                         java.net.URISyntaxException
        The first thing this method does is setting the conn variable to null to make sure no faulty remnant of an earlier connection, potentially causing conflicts, is left. The method then proceeds to initialise the conn variable with the help of the JDBC DriverManager. Should this operation fail, the corresponding exception is thrown and the variable remains null
        Specified by:
        openDatabase in class AbstractSQLiteBridge
        Throws:
        java.lang.ClassNotFoundException - if the JDBC driver class could not be loaded.
        java.sql.SQLException - if the connection could not be established for some other reason (e.g. the .db is missing or inaccessible).
        java.net.URISyntaxException - if AbstractResourceProvider.getResourceAsFile(String) throws one.

      • closeDatabase

        public void closeDatabase()
                   throws java.sql.SQLException
        Calls Connection.close() on the conn variable and then sets it to null.
        Specified by:
        closeDatabase in class AbstractSQLiteBridge
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - if conn.close() throws one.

      • queryDatabase

        public DatabaseEntry queryDatabase(java.lang.String lemma)
                            throws java.sql.SQLException
        Description copied from class: AbstractSQLiteBridge
        Queries the SQLite file for the given lemma and converts any information into a DatabaseEntry object. In the event that no entry inside the database matches the query, the returned database entry will be empty, but not null.
        Specified by:
        queryDatabase in class AbstractSQLiteBridge
        Parameters:
        lemma - the lemma to look up
        Returns:
        the corresponding DatabaseEntry object.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException

                                          WordClass wordClass,
                                          Variety variety,
                                          TranscriptionType transType,
                                          java.lang.String transcription)
                                   throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                                          java.sql.SQLException
        Description copied from class: AbstractSQLiteBridge
        Adds a transcription item to the local database.
        Specified by:
        addTranscription in class AbstractSQLiteBridge
        Parameters:
        lemma - the transcription item's corresponding lemma.
        wordClass - the transcription item's corresponding word class.
        variety - the transcription item's corresponding variety.
        transType - the transcription item's corresponding type.
        transcription - the phonetic transcription String.
        Returns:
        the TranscriptionItem object as retrieved from the database after adding the given data.

        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException

                                             WordClass wordClass,
                                             Variety variety,
                                             TranscriptionType transType,
                                             java.lang.String transcription)
                                      throws java.sql.SQLException
        Description copied from class: AbstractSQLiteBridge
        Updates an existing transcription item inside the local database.
        Specified by:
        updateTranscription in class AbstractSQLiteBridge
        Parameters:
        transID - the transcription item's corresponding ID.
        wordClass - the transcription item's new word class.

        Returns:

        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException

      • deleteLemma

        public void deleteLemma(int lemmaID)
                 throws java.sql.SQLException
        Description copied from class: AbstractSQLiteBridge
        Deletes a lemma from the local database. Since deleting a lemma from the lemmas table without clearing its corresponding transcription items may potentially damage the structure of the database (or at least lead to dead entries), this function is protected.
        Specified by:
        deleteLemma in class AbstractSQLiteBridge
        Parameters:
        lemmaID - the lemma's ID
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException

      • deleteLemma

        public void deleteLemma(java.lang.String lemma)
                 throws java.lang.Exception
        Description copied from class: AbstractSQLiteBridge
        Deletes a lemma from the local database. Since deleting a lemma from the lemmas table without clearing its corresponding transcription items may potentially damage the structure of the database (or at least lead to dead entries), this function is protected.
        Specified by:
        deleteLemma in class AbstractSQLiteBridge
        Parameters:
        lemma - the lemma
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • createTables

        @Deprecated
private void createTables()
                                throws java.sql.SQLException
        Deprecated. 
        A convenience method for debugging purposes to create the tables inside an (empty) local .db file.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException

      • initWordClasses

        @Deprecated
private void initWordClasses()
                                   throws java.sql.SQLException
        Deprecated. 
        A convenience method for debugging purposes. It will fill the wordClasses table inside the local .db file with its initial values. Since it will not check for dublicates, the table must be empty prior to calling this method.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException

      • initVarieties

        @Deprecated
private void initVarieties()
                                 throws java.sql.SQLException
        Deprecated. 
        A convenience method for debugging purposes. It will fill the varieties table inside the local .db file with its initial values. Since it will not check for dublicates, the table must be empty prior to calling this method.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException

      • getVarieties

        public Variety[] getVarieties()
                       throws java.sql.SQLException
        Description copied from class: AbstractSQLiteBridge
        Queries the database for information on the varieties it contains and converts said info into an array of Variety objects. This function should be called, when the Variety class is being loaded for the first time.
        Specified by:
        getVarieties in class AbstractSQLiteBridge
        Returns:
        an array of all Variety objects that could be found in the database.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException

      • getLemmaID

        protected int getLemmaID(java.lang.String lemma)
                  throws java.sql.SQLException
        Description copied from class: AbstractSQLiteBridge
        A convenience function to obtain the given lemma's internal ID from the local database. As no other part of the application needs to know about that number and it is only of importance for implementations of the AbstractSQLiteBridge, this function is marked as protected.
        Specified by:
        getLemmaID in class AbstractSQLiteBridge
        Parameters:
        lemma - the lemma whose ID to fetch.
        Returns:
        the lemma's corresponding ID.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException
